item.title: Repeat wont work
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

You were missing alot of semicolons, and a few 'then’s.

[code]
Program autotalk;

{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

const
f1= ‘insert text’;
f2= ‘insert text’;
f3= ‘insert text’;
f4= ‘insert text’;
f5= ‘insert text’;

procedure autotalk;
begin
if(IsFKeyDown(1))then
TypeSend(f1)
if(IsFKeyDown(2))then
TypeSend(f2)
if(IsFKeyDown(3))then
TypeSend(f3)
if(IsFKeyDown(4))then
TypeSend(f4)
if(IsFKeyDown(5))then
TypeSend(f5)
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
repeat
autotalk;
wait(1000+random(500));
until(IsFKeyDown(6));
Writeln(‘Script terminated’);
wait(1000);
Writeln(‘Goodbye’);
end.[/code]

There’s also a way to shorten that (and make it look nicer) with Cases, so I’m trying to put one together for you right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat wont work
item.dc:creator: @da_boom_king da_boom_king
item.description:
@da_boom_king wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:2, topic:135287”]First of all, my advice to you is to NEVER give up. You could have made the script work for all different types, and made an

if(blah1)or
if(blah2)or
if(blah3)then
ThrowThem;

But anyways.
Repeats are supposed to look like:

begin
  repeat
    autotalk;
    wait;
  until(false)
end.

with the procedures you want to repeat BETWEEN your ‘repeat’ and ‘until’.[/quote]

Two things…

  1. I’d never seen the enemys ingame which means I’d have to actuallty play the game to make a script for it

  2. Thanks a lot with that. I never seemed to notice that when looking at other scripts :o
    [br][size=1]Posted on: August 21, 2007, 07:16:27 AM[/size][hr][code]
    Program autotalk;

{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

const
f1= ‘insert text’
;f2= ‘insert text’
;f3= ‘insert text’
;f4= ‘insert text’
;f5= ‘insert text’

procedure autotalk;
begin
if(IsFKeyDown(1))
TypeSend(f1)or
if(IsFKeyDown(2))
TypeSend(f2)or
if(IsFKeyDown(3))
TypeSend(f3)or
if(IsFKeyDown(4))
TypeSend(f4)or
if(IsFKeyDown(5))
TypeSend(f5)
end;

begin
SetupSRL
repeat
autotalk
wait(1000+random(500))
until(IsFKeyDown(6));
Writeln(‘Script terminated’)
wait(1000)
Writeln(‘Goodbye’)
end.
[/code]

Ok…what did I do this time? It keeps saying it expects semicolonsin all these diffrent places. first it was the consts now it wants one before the begin in my frist procedure.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat wont work
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

First of all, my advice to you is to NEVER give up. You could have made the script work for all different types, and made an

if(blah1)or
if(blah2)or
if(blah3)then
ThrowThem;

But anyways.
Repeats are supposed to look like:

begin
  repeat
    autotalk;
    wait;
  until(false)
end.

with the procedures you want to repeat BETWEEN your ‘repeat’ and ‘until’.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat wont work
item.dc:creator: @da_boom_king da_boom_king
item.description:
@da_boom_king wrote:

yeah it’s me again.
When i figured out there is more than one type of enemy in defend your castle i gave up on my dea for a first script and instead decided to make an autotyper

[code]Program autotalk;

{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

procedure autotalk;
begin
TypeSend(‘this is autotyping’)
end;

procedure chatwait;
begin
wait(1000)
end;

begin
autotalk
wait
repeat
until(false)
end.[/code]

I only got this far before it got messed up. Can someone help me?

Read full topic
